inn1.comm: length ball, on a good line, around off stump and slanting a touch in. Kamran defends solidly off the front foot

and Kamran doesn't need much time to get used to New Zealand. Lovely piece of timing as Frankli lands this a foot and a half wide of off. Kamran opens the face as he eases into a square drive and finds the gap through a well populated circle on the off side
similar ball, Kamran drives it on the up this time. Nathan McCullum at point tumbles to his left and keeps it down to one
good delivery, angles into middle and off and nips into Hafeez at 128 kph. Hafeez is neither forward nor back, but keeps it out
too straight, but Hafeez misses out as he looks to flick. Hits him on the pads, safely down the leg side

well, well, what happened there? Full length ball on off stump, Hafeez pressed across to defend, but there was a small gap between bat and pad, it squeezed through it, possibly off the inside edge, but ballooned and died on McCullum who dived forward and could not scoop it in time. Was there an edge?
ooh, he begins with a looses cannon. Full and wide outside off, it swings away like it has a mind of its own and Kamran has a swish at it. He misses, McCullum fumbles.
over-pitched outside off and again moving away nicely, Kamran drives without getting fully across, to Ryder at cover point
holds the length back a touch, and Kamran chooses not to drive. Defended from the crease
pleasing shape from Southee again, at lively pace too - 136 kph. Another one lands on a length around middle stump and straightens. Kamran punches it down the track, but not too well-timed.
this time he slants it down the leg, lost in search of the dream ball. Kamran flicks it to fine leg for one
on Hafeez's pads this time, and for the second time he's missed out on an easy scoring opportunity

strong finish to the over. The perfect away-going delivery, slants in from a touch wide of the crease, lands on a length and straightens, squaring up the batsman and taking the outside edge. It went straight down and ran towards point
not much movement at this end, full on off stump and Kamran defends compactly to the off side
smart change in length, dangling the bait outside off and getting it to hold its line and go with the angle. Kamran has a feel at it, but doesn't nick it
solid defence again, to a straighter ball. Positive footwork from Kamran, getting nicelt across to cover the line
back of a length, on middle stump, Kamran stays back and defends down the track
over-pitched, well outside off and Kamran goes for the drive, but he hasn't got across. Mis-times the shot to mid-off

another good finish to the over, Franklin finally gets the ball to deviate, starts on off stump and begins to straighten, but not enough to hit the stumps. Rapped on the pads as Kamran was reaching out, but there is no appeal
Southee holds the length back outside off, Hafeez opens the face and drops it to the off side
goes fuller, invites the drive, but doesn't get the deviation this time. Hafeez middles the shot this time, but straight to mid off

loud appeal for lbw as Southee scrambles the seam and somehow gets it to jag back into Hafeez, who moves his front foot a mile across and then is in trouble as he looks to get the bat around to the ball. He managed to get an inside edge onto the pads though, that saved him.

Southee has outdone Hafeez with a lovely bit of bowling here. Out-thought and outdone. After getting the previous ball to nip in, he gets this one to dart away from just outside off. Perfect length too, Hafeez stayed on the back foot and tentatively dangled the bat at it, mostly in hope. It took the edge and nestled in McCullum's gloves.
full on off stump and Younis is away with a nicely timed steer past point. Back for a couple.

Southee keeps probing away, another subtle change in length. Fullish ball, looking for the dream outswinger from middle and leg. Younis had to arrest his forward lunge quickly to defend to the off side
back of a length outside off, Kamran goes for the big booming cover drive, but it goes without much boom towards cover. Mistimed due to lack of footwork

nice save at short fine leg, that ball had four bonus runs written on it, as it landed outside leg and Kamran timed the glance perfectly. The fielder at short fine moved quickly to his left and tumbled to save four runs.
full and straight on off stump, Kamran eases the check drive towards mid off
fractionally wider outside off and Kamran opens the face to guide it square for one
angles a full delivery across Younis at 126 kph and he drives solidly into the covers

good running at the end of the day. Full delivery outside off, Younis moved into the drive and used the wrists to play it to the left of Guptill at point. It seemed like a tight run, but Younis made it before the throw come in.

Southee continues to do a decent fast bowler's impression of legspin. Another sharp away seamer, sucks Younis into the waft after getting forward, and gets the edge. Unfortunately for Southee, it was a thick edge that eluded the two slips
another one that moves away from off stump, Younis opens the face and guides square for one
back of a length outside off, Kamran hangs back in the crease and check drives into the covers
every now and then, Southee gets one to jag back in off the seam. Good combination - outswing and in-seam. Kamran is cut in half as he stays back in the crease

this is top-class new-ball bowling, from a different era almost. That's how rare good sideways movement has become these days. Southee tries what he did successfully against Hafeez, follows up the inducker with the away swinger again. Hafeez was good enough to edge it, Kamran was not.
stays back in the crease, carefully watching the movement off the track, before defending to the off side
short of a length outside off, Younis pounces back in the crease and looks for the square cut, but finds Ryder at point

mix-up, but safe. Length ball, on the stumps and holding its line, Younis looks to play to the leg side as he falls across, and is running even as he played it. Kamran was never interested, and rightly so. Franklin ran down to the right of the pitch on his follow through and attempted an under-arm flick towards the stumps, but missed, as Younis dived in.
outside off this time, Younis unfurls a solid looking drive but finds cover

boy, how close was that to short fine leg? Not a very smart delivery from Franklin, short ball without pace on leg stump and it was there for the pull. It came off so slowly that Younis mistimed the pull, and it went menacingly close to short fine leg before running away to the boundary
reaches across with an angled face to pick up a single behind backward point
dropped back of a length on the pads and Kamran works it square for one

Kamran combusts. Southee has kept testing them from a length outside off, getting them to move away from the right handers. Kamran has another flash at it, but the movement took it away from the middle. He was going uppish with this, so Ryder was always in business at point. He moved quickly to the left to complete a tumbling take, as graceful as his frame would allow him to be.
and the away swinger continues to work perfectly. Lands on a length outside off and moves away from new man Asad Shafiq who lets it go
another one, this is superb use of the seam. Asad sees it carefully and does well to resist from flashing at it

this time Southee foxes him into the shot, but does so much with the ball that Asad misses the drive. Lands on driving length as it comes in with the angle and then swerves away like a yoyo. He was driving in another zip code altogether.

unlucky for the bowler. Once again, Southee slips in the inducker after making the batsman look out of his depth with an away swinger. Asad did not see it coming, was taken by surprise by the slight shortening of length and then by the inward movement. He tried to cover the line in a hurry, but only got an inside edge that whistled past leg stump for four
that's not a bad idea. Leave outside off as another one moves away
and begins with a gentle away swinger at 129 kph that forces the drive out of Younis. He misses though
back of a length this time, a foot outside off, Younis opens the face and steers square for one
this time he starts the movement from too far outside off and it is called a wide
short of a length and good bounce outside off, Asad lets it go after reaching across
pushes Asad back with a back of length delivery with decent lift. Defended compactly off the back foot towards the covers
and a spiffing legcutter now from Oran. Seam bolt upright, landed with purpose back of a length outside off and then it moves away with disconcerting bounce. Shafiq did well not to edge that
another one. It moved away lesser, making it more likely to take a wicket, but Asad played inside the line and did not get the edge. Oram has hit the ground running here.
good footwork from Younis, gets well forward and across to a full away seamer outside off and guides it off the face, square for a single
another one that goes away, Shafiq is more confident leaving those that begin well outside off
poor shot selection from Shafiq, stays back and looks to play an ambitious square cut to a ball that wasn't short enough or wide enough for the shot. It swerves away and misses the edge

see you later Asad Shafiq. Having snared two with the away swing, he's now got one with the inducker. Shafiq was not reading the movement at all, and has been made to look out of his depth in his short stay. He came forward and across in hope this time and played all around it. Rapped in front of middle, and despite the angle, umpire Saheba reckons that was crashing into the furniture. Replays are in, that actually hit him well high on the pads. Might have been a rough call.
Misbah stays in the crease and watches and one angles in from wide of the crease and straightens outside off
Similar ball, probably closer to the stumps this time, and another leave from Misbah
Oram darts one away from wide of off stump, Younis reaches across and leaves
this one holds its line, and Younis is alert to the variation as he gets across and defends to the off side. They take a quick single
Misbah stays firmly in the back foot - good idea too, will help him pick the movement off the pitch. Defends a length ball to the off side
first hint of uneven bounce outside off, Misbah gets back and across for the cut, but misses
another one on the perfect length from Oram, it holds its line again and is defended solidly to the off side
slightly fuller, Misbah stays on the crease and defends with the full face to the leg side
Southee holds the length back and gets another one to straighten from outside off. Defended off the back foot square on the off side
a rare delivery overcooked by Southee, wide down the leg side
back on track, full on middle and swerving away prodigiously, Younis does really well to defend that off the middle of the bat
play and a miss outside off, Younis had a feel at it as it moved away, but he did not get an edge.

nicely played and well fielded. Southee ekes the drive out of Younis with a good length ball, it is timed pretty well down the ground, and Vettori moves quickly to his right from mid off to tumble and stop.
very good adjustment from Misbah to another Southee special away seamer. Moves away from off stump, Misbah opens the face and opens up his stance as he meets the ball, to defend towards point
full on off stump, Misbah covers the line more easily this time and defends to mid off
movement and spongy bounce, both causing problems here. This one was back of a length outside off and Younis went for the cut, but it just did not come on. Inside edged into the body
fuller outside off, played with the full face towards mid off
slips down the leg side for another wide

another offcutter of sorts from Oram, at 128 kph, Younis inside edge the cut to the right of the pitch and they hare across for a quick single. Oram runs across and kicks the ball at the stumps, but misses. Misbah was not dragging his bat in. Hmm.
back of a length outside off and defended to the off side
pushes off the back foot to midwicket, can't find the gap
and Misbah is finally away, steering a cut past point for a couple

and he bowls a real heavy ball this man. 140 kph, hits the deck outside off and Younis goes for the cut. He misses. Interesting action, huge leap before release, almost a two-legged hop, that propels him a whole metre at least before banging it in. A distinct resemblance in style to Debashis Mohanty.
closer to a length outside off and Younis gets it away square for one
comes into Misbah from wide of the crease and it is defended to the off side.
140 kph again, moves away a fraction from outside off and Misbah misses as he looks to drive. Good delivery
and a sharp delivery that seams in from outside off this time. Misbah was walking into the defensive shot and got an inside edge onto the pads. That saved him from the big appeal for lbw
gets bat on ball in a better way this time, punches a full delivery on off through covers for one
Oram slants one in from wide of the crease and Misbah somehow gets it away off the inside half for a single to the leg side
slips down the leg side and concedes a wide

slow offcutter at 127 kph and a huge appeal for lbw from Oram. Younis was decieved by the change of pace, he was well forward and into the shot by the time the ball came on and struck him on the pad. Might have been sliding down the leg. Debatable call, ruled in the batsman's favour. Replays suggest it was going high, so good decision.
Oram bounced that closer to Younis at the non-striker's end that Misbah. Very short, called wide for height.
pushes Misbah back in the crease with one back of a length and it is forced to the off side
beats the outside edge again, we have seen this so many times this morning. Misbah plants the front foot and then feels for one that moves away like it has a charm put on it.
fuller this time and Misbah launches an expansive cover drive for one to the sweeper. The players will break for drinks
length ball on off at 140 kph, holds its line and is defended off the front foot behind point
another one in the zone outside off and Misbah mistimes a cover drive as badly as it can be mistimed. Still finding his range, Misbah.
opens the face and looks to pinch a single square, but Jesse Ryder at point moves quickly across and dives to stop it. Poetry in motion, as I was saying ...
slightly over-pitched, Misbah times the drill shot back down the track and Bennett does well to stop it on his follow through

agonisingly close to being caught but Misbah survives. More of that tennis ball bounce from Bennett who bangs it in short and this one comes through at its own leisurely pace. Misbah shapes for the pull, waits and waits and plays a sort of mosquito swat in the time. It loops dangerously close to the fielder running across from mid-on, but was safe
opens the face and defends the final ball off the back foot to point
good length on off stump and hinting at shaping away from Misbah who adjusts for the movement and defends
looks for the off drive to a full ball on off stump, but mistimes to mid off
slants this one into the pads and Misbah works it through midwicket for one
smart work from Younis, back of a length on off stump, he drops it softly to the leg side and takes a single
dream delivery from Oram, the deceptively gentle away swinger. Misbah nearly falls for its charms, hanging the bat out there in a trance as it nips away. Close to the edge that one.
Oram does a Southee. Follows up the outswing with an offcutter. Misbah nearly does a Shafiq, he was late to bring the bat down on that and got an inside edge, just past leg stump
a rare half-volley from Bennett and Misbah times the straight drive very well, but can't get it past the huge frame of the bowler
short ball and huge bounce outside off. Bennett's broad shoulders eking out some extra juice from this pitch. It lifts a mile, outside off, and Misbah leaves
this one ends up on middle and leg, Misbah moves inside the line and works a single wide of mid on
overcooks the bouncer and McCullum does some football goalkeeping, jumping up as he would if he was parrying it over the cross bar, and pouches it in one hand
short of a length outside off, stays beside the line and plays it with angled face into the off side
this one tails in from wide of the crease, Younis gets across and inside the line before nudging it square for the 50th run
full on the pads, a rare poor delivery, and it is clipped well through square lg. Huge effort from the fine-leg fielder, running across and sliding to save the boundary
bangs it in, more of that balloonish, indifferent bounce. It is left alone.
back of a length outside off, gently dabbed towards wide mid off for a single. That's what Pakistan want.
short ball outside off, Misbah rides the bounce and plays with opened face towards point
this one angles into him and Misbah looks to work it to the leg side, but can't get it off the square
Misbah walks across to off stump and works a length ball towards square leg for another single
hmm, Oram moves the 19-overs-old ball away off the seam and Younis steers it uppishly through a now vacant gully region for one
132 kph, shortish ball coming into Younis, who quietly plays it towards mid on for one. He's beginning to get used to this pitch now
back of a length and marginally outside off, Misbah crunches out a cur shot towards deep backward point, but can only get a single

oh no, I seem to have put the commentator's curse on Younis. 136 kph, back of a length delivery, it seemed to hurry onto Younis who was late on a forcing shot off the back foot. It took a thin outside edge through to McCullum. He was probably better off defending it. Surely seemed like he misread the pace on that one.

Bennett is on a hat-trick and Pakistan are deep in trouble now. Nothing shot from Umar Akmal, first ball. That was short of a length outside off, did not do too much off the track compared to what we have seen today. He could have let that go easily, but chose to dangle a hopelessly angled face of the bat well away from the body at it. Nicked and it carries through to the left of second slip who takes a nice tumbling catch. Umar Akmal is done in by poor shot selection, as much as by the bounce

140 kph bouncer from Bennett, should he have been attacking the stumps? Even Afridi managed to let that go. Strange things happening at gully - Ryder runs in a good 5 metres and positions himself at a catching position when the bowler is in his run up. That's not allowed, I'm sorry. Very poor sportsmanship. The batsman could not have seen him. This was not just a walk in.

and an absolute jaffa to end the over. Afridi was not just squared up, he was cubed up as that nipped away and took off from a length. Not many batsmen would have managed to edge that. Afridi did not.,
back of a length, not much turn and Misbah forces towards mid on for a single
and the armer that slides on menacingly. Afridi is late on the cut, and only just manages to get bat on it
fuller this time, Afridi comes forward and defends resolutely
tossed up on off, Afridi drives with the spin past mid off for one
Misbah stays back and works it off the pads behind square for one
Misbah times a steer from close to the body straight to point

that's the most awesome piece of placement you will ever see. Though not intentional. Misbah stays back to a length ball, opens the face and looks to steer square, ends up getting it too fine and inch-perfect through the almost non-existent gap between keeper and slip.
short ball comes into Misbah from outside off and he drops it to the leg side
short ball just outside off, another forced cut that finds the point fielder

Bennett suggests he is going to land this further up, Afridi suggests he is getting ready to plonk the front foot forward. It ended up being back of a length and he ended just defending it after the half-cock movement forward
pacy delivery comes in with the angle, Afridi drops it to the leg side of the pitch and takes a quick single
tossed up on off, Afridi looks to drive, but mistimes straight back at the bowler
very full on the stumps and Afridi manages to squeeze it out on the leg side for one
tossed up on middle and leg, Misbah comes reluctantly forward and defends
full again, slightly quicker through the air and it is defended to the leg side off the front foot
Misbah reaches out to a flighted ball on off and drives it with the spin through mid off

Afridi is let off! You almost sensed he was eager to get to the striker's end and have a go at Vettori. He succumbed to the temptation the moment he got the chance, prancing down the track and looking to launch him straight out of New Zealand. He did not get to the pitch, and mishits a dolly at Oram running to his right from long on. And he fluffs it!

To say Afridi is living dangerously would be an understatement. Looks to flick a length ball from outside off. And gets a leading edge. That flies over the covers. And somehow clears the fielder running back
beaten outside off as he looks to cut a short ball outside off
cherish this rare moment, it is an Afridi leave outside the off stump, on line. He actually shouldered arms to a length ball after thinking of defending it
and again, we are living in privileged times here. Afridi chooses to let another one go through

what happened there? Huge noise as the ball passes the outside edge, but there is no appeal. Replays are in, it wasn't from bat hitting ball - there was daylight between the two. A smile on McCullum's face - credit to NZ for not appealing for that one.
Afridi gets bat on ball, viciously cutting outside off for a single to third man
Afridi goes back to a flat delivery from Vettori and cuts. He wants two, he is eager for strike. But can only get one
Misbah skips out, and ends up getting too close to the ball. Squeezed off the bottom edge towards midwicket
full on off, Afridi unfurls a powerful drive straight to cover
the skidder, hurries into Afridi who stays back and manages to play to the off side
flighted on leg at 91 kph, Vettori is varying his pace nicely here. Misbah tries to get inside the line and work it to the leg side, but finds short fine leg
turns away from off at 94 kph and Misbah defends with the spin to the off side.
not immediately. This one slants into the pads and is worked fine for one
bangs it short and sends it wide down the leg side
Afridi continues to find gaps with big mid-hits over the infield. This short ball stops on him and he doesn't time the pull at all. Gets it to land safely behind midwicket for a couple
fuller on off stump, Afridi quietly taps into the covers for a single
offcutter on off stump at 134 kph, Misbah defends from the crease towards point
short ball into Misbah's body at 131 kph and he pulls it towards deep fine leg for one
length ball at 137 kph on off stump and it is defended to the off side

Huge appeal for caught behind turned down. That one was sliding down the leg side and Misbah was looking for the tickle. Once again, incredibly, a noise when the ball was passing the bat but there did not seem to be an edge.
Misbah guides him with the spin off the back foot towards point for one

The McCullums come together to nearly end Misbah's stay. Afridi drops it softly towards Nathan at cover for one, Misbah prances across and Nathan fires in the under-arm throw on the move. He misses the stumps by a whisker, giving Misbah just enough time to make his gorund.
tossed up outside off, Misbah opens the face and picks a single through the off side
short ball turning away from Afridi who backs away and whacks it through the covers. Fielded in the deep, but they get two
136 kph back of a length, not much movement from Southee any more. Misbah looks to guide off the back foot and misses. Again a ghost noise out of the stump mic. Uncanny!
fuller on off, Misbah connects with the steer this time. Single behind point
steady length outside off at 137 kph, Afridi looks to pinch a single to the off side, but finds point

Southee takes Afridi out. Not with movement now, but with a little extra bounce and steady unrelenting lengths. This got slightly big on Afridi who looked to steer through the off side. Slightly reminiscent of Umar Akmal's dismissal, except that this went a little finer. Brendon McCullum leaps across and gobbles it mid-air. 200 ODI catches for him.
lets one go through just outside off.
slants this one into the pads and Razzaq works it square for one.
straightens from off stump line, Razzaq stays in the crease and defends to the off side
tight line on middle and off, straightening prodigiously on landing. Razzaq just manages to keep it out

Vettori nearly does his throat with a desperate appeal. Another one straightens from middle and off, but probably wasn't doing enough to his the furniture as it rapped Razzaq's pads. Replays say it was too high too.
works this one from middle and leg towards mid on for one
Misbah defends a quickish delivery just outside off.
on middle and leg again, Misbah works him through mid on for one to retain strike
back of a length outside off and Misbah steers from close to his body towards point
plays with an angled face this time and gets a single towards third man

I think that's just the second convicing boundary of the day, since Kamran's drive in the opening over. Lovely hands from Razzaq, generates bat speed out of nowhere to a length ball close to the off stump. He just opened the wrists and eased it square for four
better line this time, on the stumps and defended to the leg side

Brendon McCullum continues to do well in this extended catching practice session. Razzaq this time, gets half forward, and hangs an angled bat miles away from his body. It takes the edge, loops away to McCullum's right and he pounces on it with glee. Pakistan continue to collapse...

on a hat-trick for the second time in the day. This time Oram. And McCullum. Another bit of catching practice, this time to McCullum's left. Abdul Rehman gets a better delivery than Razzaq did - he had to play at it as it angled across close to his body. Thicker edge that before, this one makes McCullum dive across and he takes it nearly in front of the first slip. McCullum completes a five-for.
works a length ball from the pads to the leg side.
tossed up outside off and he lets it go
again inviting length outside off, Tanvir reaches out to defend
more obdurate defence from off stump.
tails into the pads and it is worked to the leg side for a single
hustles in from over the wicket, on middle stump, Tanvir gets behind the line and defends
fuller on middle and Tanvir works it to the leg side carefully
fuller on off stump, Tanvir presses forward and defends to the off side
Tanvir leaves a ball. Or atleast tries to. As he is shouldering arms outside off it hits the meat of the bat and runs away through gully for one.
short ball, too close to the body for the cut. Misbah rides the bounce and steers it to backward point
full ball on middle and off, Tanvir keeps it out with obdurate defence. No hat-trick this time either
this one angles across Tanvir outside off and he steers it carefully behind point for one. 100 up for Pakistan. Some solace.
Oram gets one to move in off the seam, and Misbah just about covers the deviation with bat and pad after getting half forward
Misbah works it through midwicket from off stump line and gets a single.
short ball angling across Tanvir again, he stays back and guides it into the covers
comes into Tanvir from round the wicket and he defend it to the leg side off the back foot

Misbah nearly departs. Looks to launch Bennett over mid-on, but it was not the driving length. He almost scooped it straight to mid-on, but it was so badly timed, it did not carry even to the fielder inside the circle
stays back this time and drops him into the covers for a single
Tanvir looks for an ambitions square-punch, and connects with thin air as Oram cramps him for room outside off
Tanvir produces the third good boundary of the day. Back of a length delivery and enough room for Tanvir to time the steer well through point. He found the gap perfectly too
he's not given any room this time, Tanvir defends with an angled face into the off side

nine down. Jesse Ryder gets catching practice now. Full delivery, landed invitingly outside off stump, Tanvir walks into a square drive and fails to keep it down. Straight to Ryder who takes it without a problem
full toss on the pads, Misbah slaps towards deep midwicket and now refuses the single
yorker on middle and leg at 129 kph, Misbah drives down the ground. Another single refused.
Misbah backs away to the leg side, Oram sees him and delivers it nice and wide outside off. Dot ballo
Misbah looks to slog another full delivery, from leg stump through midwicket and misses.

lovely connection. Finally Misbah sends one out of the ground. Oram delivers an off cutter outside off. Misbah goes down on a knee, reminscent of circa 2007 World T20, and slams it over deep midwicket into the stands.
Oram ends the over sensibly with a full ball that it worked towards mid on for one. Misbah keeps strike
back of a length outside off, Misbah defends off the back foot to the off side ... Meanwhile the TV commentators have started talking about some football. It's the batting Powerplay people!
Misbah spanks another nice boundary. Too little too late? Over-pitched by Southee on off stump, Misbah again sets his base nicely, down on a knee and carves this over the covers.
good comeback, follows Misbah who is backing away rampantly and ensures he can't do much with it

Misbah smokes another one. Down the ground this time. He backs away, he walks back across, Southee is thoroughly confused but delivers a seemingly safe full ball outside off. Not safe -  Misbah smashes it off the middle despite not being on the front foot and it is four between bowler and mid off. That's what Ravi Shastri calls a tracer bullet.
looks to chop this one from outside off, and decides against a single. He needs one now.
Aha, Southee tries to bowl a bouncer dot-ball, but ends up dropping too short. Called a wide for height.
and he can't get the single. Misbah will be disappointed. He got a short ball that could have been pulled anywhere, but he found midwicket inside the circle
and he's away now too. Stays in the crease and blocks Oram into the covers for one
Misbah continues to go for a stroll around his crease, Oram follows him with a yorker on leg stump. Hits the pads, but safe.
looks to hustle one past the midwicket boundary, makes very good connection but he finds the man at deep midwicket. There is a deep square leg as well. They know this is Misbah's hitting area.
another heave across the line, again straight to the deep midwicket fielder. Another single refused. On 49.

Misbah has got an important 50 here - may not be important for this game, but with the World Cup coming up this will spark a huge captaincy debate. He has been as calm and assured as Afridi hasn't. Works a full ball past wide mid on for a single
Shoaib keeps the last ball out, a full toss on off stump defended into the covers
length ball, giving Misbah no room and he looks to make his own by getting inside the line. Can't get it away to the leg side though.
short ball, hurries him into the pull shot and Misbah can't time it at all this time

five for Southee! Misbah looks bemused. Even mildly amused. He breaks into a wry smile. This is why: It was an offcutter at 133 kph. Misbah spotted the variation and moved across the stumps to look for the tickle to the leg side. It missed the bat, and hit the bottom on his thigh pad, en route to the stumps. It may have hit the stumps in any case. Misbah is distraught. He was looking to whimper this score closer to 150. Pakistan have almost nothing to defend here.

inn2.comm: menace at 146 kph straight away! Almost a yorker on leg stump, Guptill just about squeezes it off the inside edge behind square for two
pacy again, on the pads and Guptill clips it in a pleasing manner for a couple through square leg
he's off a golden duck now. Stays in the crease and dabs a delivery outside off towards point
Ryder motors down the track to get off the mark. Back of a length outside off, he drops it with soft hands towards cover and takes off. Nicely done
back of a length on off stump at 147 kph, Guptill has no problem picking a single to the off side.
over-pitched on middle, he seemed to be looking to burst through Jesse's defences, but has been driven against the angle into the covers for one
and some shape away from the right hander immediately. Moves away from middle stump, but is defended compactly by Guptill
drifts down the leg side for a wide
too straight and Guptill cashes in with another pleasing flick. Gets it past midwicket and then bustles across ewith purpose, convincing Ryder to go for three
back of a length at 128 kph, no movement for Tanvir, Ryder works it off the face of the bat towards point
he's not pitching it up enough for movement. Ryder stays back again and cracks it into the covers
sloppy from Umar Akmal at point. Runs across to his left and dives over the ball as Ryder steers square. Gets two for his efforts.
into the pads this time. Not much pace from Tanvir, 128 kph, clipped crisply, but straight to midwicket
Shoaib drops it short, Guptill rides the bounce well and defend sto the off side

emphatically drilled by Guptill. 144 kph, no problemo. It was over-pitched on off stump, Guptill was onto it so early that he did not have to drive it square. He just slammed it off the ftont foot to the right of mid-off for four. Nobody moved.
better length, holds it back and negates the drive. Guptill ends up feeling for it outside off and misses
thickish outside edge as Guptill tries to force it square, and they get a single towards point
ominous movements here from NZ's openers. Ryder doesn't bother with trifles like footwork - he just sets himself up and looks to rifle a cover drive for four. He finds the fielder though.
slants into the pads this time, Ryder looks to work it square, but can't get bat on it. Balloons up off the pad towards square leg
back of a length and angling across the right hader who defends into the off side
uppish but safe. 124 kph from Tanvir, on leg stump, too slow for Guptill's liking as he checks his punch down the ground a little late. Nearly spoons it straight to mid on

Guptill looks for the good old plonk-and-tonk, but doesn't make contact. Tanvir gets this one to nip away from off as Guptill plants the front foot across and looks to launch down the ground. Meets with thin air.
this one's angled miles outside off and Guptill can'teven reach it
more effort in the short ball - 129 kph - Guptill is a moment late on the pull shot and finds midwicket, who nearly concedes an overthrow with an unnecessary throw.
this one angles across Guptill, who chooses to let it go
Sohail having take-off problems here. Another shabby wide, well outside off
under-edges a cut off the eventual final delivery, that stayed a touch low

Ryder does what he tried to do last over. His footwork was conspicuous by its absence. He stayed back and slammed it on the up as it angled across, over the heads of the men inside the circle on the off side.
this time Ryder looks to go the other way, using the angle to hoick him over the leg side. Not so well timed, but good enough for two over the infield
more respect this time, Ryder defends a length ball on the pads.

ka-boom. Ryder is getting into some serious hitting zone here. Another pacy delivery, not there for the drive. Did not matter. Ryder stood and delivered. Just slapped it on the up, and it flew past mid off for four

Hoo hoo Hook! Shoaib shifts back to over the wicket and bangs it in short at the mid-140s. Ryder calmly swivels on the backfoot, meets the ball at the top of its trajectory with a superbly executed hook shot. It sails into the crowds.
and finishes with a single through midwicket. Keeps strike for the next over
length ball on the stumps, Ryder defends compactly from the crease
another wide from Tanvir, this time outside the left-hander's off stump. Ryder wants to have a go, all the same! Misses the slash though

Ryder dumps another one over mid-off. Not the best bit of timing, but he's getting away with these thanks to the complete lack of movment from the Pakistan's seamers. Couple of bounces over mid-off. Ryder hasn't moved his feet even once today.
finally Tanvir gets one to move in. Ryder is cramped as he looks to cut and wisely changes his mind
full delivery on off stump, defended solidly to mid-off

the Pakistan fans are probably going to disagree, but this shot reminds me of Saeed Anwar. Full delivery on off, Ryder goes down on a knee and slap-flicks this as he would deal with an errant kid. Clears the ropes at midwicket easily.
can't punish the last ball, had enough room outside off to play the cover drive and he again times it well, but finds cover.
and begins with a wide down the leg side

and Guptill's away. It's almost like he never went inside for lunch. If he did, he probably ate something special. He's just punched a full delivery from middle and leg line without any fuss - no backlift, almost no follow through. It slows up near the boundary, they get three.

Ryder's probably eaten one of these muscle enhancers at the break. He continues to muscle them away. Feet firmly planted in the crease, they'll make a good endorsement for a cement company. And then the hands take over, and the bat comes through. Crack. Pick it up at the cover boundary.
Shoaib bangs it in, Ryder's ready with the pull. This time he rolls the wrists over it, keeps it down and sends it scurrying through square leg
tried to cut off the backfoot towards backward point.
slow offcutter, 117 kph and he gets an outside edge away to third man.
drives this one between cover and cover point for a couple of runs
Guptill lets his first ball go through outside off
nips away from a length, Guptill calmly steers it square for one
this one is wide outside off and is called
short ball, better direction than the previous one and Ryder lets it go
superb save by Misbah, diving away to his left from cover to save the boundary as Ryder launches himself into another booming cover drive
this one drifts onto the pads and Guptill tucks it fine for one
this time on Ryder's pads, and he nudges square to turn the strike. Tanvir has been all over the place today.

Ryder rolls on like a fluent river, finding a way through the rocks on its way - the fielders in the covers. Back of a length outside off, he leans half forward and caresses it through a very small gap
drives the second ball back to the bowler
tries to force a ball from outside off, and plays it straight to cover
over-pitched on middle and leg, Guptill digs it out to mid-on and picks up a single
Ryder has flown to 50. Back of a length at 128 kph, on middle and leg, he inside edges a defensive shot to the leg side and takes a single
short ball, Guptill pounces on it but doesn't time the pull well enough to beat midwicket
out of nowhere, Tanvir gets one to jag back in sharply. It lands outside off, darts into Guptill, cuts him up and then somehow eludes the stumps.
gets pad on this one, fuller on the stumps and gets a leg bye towards midwicket
Ryder glides one off the angled face from outside off towards third man for one
cheeky single. On a length in line with off stump and its been dropped to the off side for another steal
Ryder's had enough of the pinching singles business for the over. He picks a slow offcutter at 119 kph early, plonks the front foot across and smacks it straight back down the ground.

did that carry? Looks like it just might have. Ryder gets a full ball on middle and leg, gets inside the line and times the flick-pull so well that it carries to Asad Shafiq close to the boundary at midwicket. Pakistan have something to celebrate.
back of a length outside off, and tapped into the off side for one
fullish ball on off stump, defended down the track
similar ball, similar response. Defended compactly down the track
third time he's defended back down the track. "He can keep doing this all through his innings and still New Zealand will win," says Rameez Raja on air.
Taylor seems to have the same plan. Another compact forward defensive

huge appeal for caught behind, turned down by Umpire Saheba. That moved away from Taylor, who was fending after committing to the front foot. There was a noise as it passed, but did he edge it? Replays awaited. Looks like he did not get an edge after all.
taps it off the pads to midwicket for one
Taylor clips this off the pads towards midwicket for one. Tight single to Misbah, but he makes it and is off the mark.
goes for the cut and it gets big on him. Misses the outside edge.
another stolen single. Guptill taps it down the track off the back foot and Tanvir doesn't stop it on his follow through. Afridi from mid-off did not have a chance
Taylor opens the face and drops it towards point. Can't get the run
this time, Tanvir comes in the way as Taylor works it from middle and leg towards mid-on.
Razzaq keeps it on a length around off stump and Guptill defends it to the off side
drifts into the pads and Guptill clips it square for a single

pleasing stroke from Taylor who manufactures a boundary with some smart footwork. He walks across the stumps and forward to convert a length ball on off into a half volley on the legs. He then simply chips it with the wrists over midwicket for four
Razzaq moves it outside off stump and Taylor tries to force it into the covers, but can't get it away
defends a length ball on off stump down the track
looks to walk across again, but the length is not there so he ends up defending to the leg side of the pitch
on a length at 125 kph, Guptill plays the on-drive towards mid on

Bang. Every now and then, one of these New Zealand batsmen decides to stamp their authority with an emphatic bounbdary. Guptill comes down the track with his initial movement, gets to the pitch of a full ball on the stumps and tees off straight down the ground for a couple of bounces over the ropes
the length is promptly pulled back and he drops it to the leg side for another single
this one angles across Taylor who lets it go through
length ball on middle and leg, played with soft hands towards midwicket for another single
angles this one wide across the batsman, and very short. Guptill misses out, finding backward point with his late cut
back of a length on off stump, defended back down the track
enough room outside off this time for Taylor to place the cut to deep point and bring up the 100th run
slanted too far down the leg side and Guptill works it behind square for another easy single
Taylor walks right across his furniture and works one from off stump line towards midwicket. Two more to the cause.
short and straying down the leg side, easy run for Taylor who nudges behind square

it's almost a calculated effort to produce a boundary, at least once every other over. Another poor ball from Razzaq, angling into the pads, Guptill gets the front foot in line and goes airborne over midwicket. Clean wrist-work and good placement.
fullish on off stump, driven back to the bowler
100 kph, holds the length back, Taylor defends again
wrong 'un turns into the batsman who works it easily behind square for a single
Guptill stays back and looks to tap a single to the off side. Can't get the gap though.
horrible piece of fielding by Umar Akmal. Takes an eternity to return the throw from point, as the batsmen were trying a tight run. In the end, Taylor made it easily
ends up with a single to retain strike. Worked to deep midwicket
turn straight away, across the face of the bat and an outside edge, but safely to point
and he drops short now. Taylor is so quick and decisive with his footwork, ready for the cut immediately and conscious to beat backward point to his left. Four more.
fired in short and flat at 98 kph, Taylor works it back to the bowler off the back foot

Mis-hit but safely over square leg for six. That's the patent Ross Taylor slog-sweep across the line. It was in the slot, on middle and leg at a nice length but he seemed to get be a little late on the shot and hence the top edge. It just kept going, carried over Shoaib on the ropes easily
short outside off and he looks to cut, can't find the gap this time.
full on off, flicked powerfully, but midwicket intercepts. Almost a run out at the bowler's end, but the throw misses as Guptill dives in
is that the end of the game? Not yet, one more to go. Gutill looks to slam one through the off side and gets a thick outside edge that runs away very fine towards third man for three

Taylor finishes it off with a flick towards midwicket and picks up a single. This is a walloping. In a 50-overs a side game, we have had under 55 overs all counted. And New Zealand have won a game for first time since what seems like the Mesozoic era.
